data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Textile and Garmenting Policy 2022 - Employment Generation Subsidy - New
data.benefits: Subsidy of INR 3,200/- per worker per month will be provided to garmenting units, except in Gautam Budh Nagar and Ghaziabad district, for a period of 5 years.
data.eligibility: All MSME and Non MSMEs are defined on the basis of “Investment on Plant & Machinery” and “Employment Generation”.
data.conditions:
1st Criteria:
Bundelkhand & Poorvanchal region:
Investment Range: INR 50 to 75 Crores
or
Employment: Minimum 500 (Minimum 1,000 for garmenting units)

Rest of Uttar Pradesh:
Investment Range: INR 75 to 125 Crores
or
Employment: Minimum 750 (Minimum 1,500 for garmenting units)

2nd Criteria
Bundelkhand & Poorvanchal region:
Investment: More than INR 75 Crores
or
Employment: Minimum 750 (Minimum 1,500 for garmenting units)

Rest of Uttar Pradesh:
Investment: More than INR 125 Crores
or
Employment: Minimum 1,000 (Minimum 2,000 for garmenting units)

In order to avail the employment generation subsidy, every person employed in the unit should be enrolled in EPF and should have a valid Aadhaar number and the payment of salary to the employee by the unit should be done by DBT in his bank account.

This employment generation subsidy will be provided to those Garmenting Units which cumulatively set up the first 15,000 sewing machines to encourage early investors.
data.beneficiaries: All MSME and Non MSMEs are defined on the basis of “Investment on Plant & Machinery” and “Employment Generation”.

In order to avail the employment generation subsidy, every person employed in the unit should be enrolled in EPF and should have a valid Aadhaar number and the payment of salary to the employee by the unit should be done by DBT in his bank account.

This employment generation subsidy will be provided to those Garmenting Units which cumulatively set up the first 15,000 sewing machines to encourage early investors.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Textile, Department of Textile
data.context: Uttar Pradesh is one of the largest markets for apparel and textiles and possesses one of the largest pools of young and trained workforce. In addition, the state has one of the most competitive work force, abundant and good quality of water & power, which are favourable conditions for the labour intensive textile manufacturing. Considering the immense potential for growth that exists in this sector, Uttar Pradesh is ideally positioned to benefit from this opportunity. This policy is aimed to promote and develop a robust textile industry that generates employment and positions Uttar Pradesh as one of the most preferred destination for Textile and Apparel industry.
data.objective:
a) Attract investment in the textile and apparel sector to the tune of INR 10,000 Crore

 b) Generate employment opportunity for 5 lakh persons

 c) Development of five (05) Textile and Apparel Parks through private sector 

d) 50% increase in earnings of Handloom and Power loom weavers 

e) Modernization of power looms and their operation through solar energy 

f) Increase production of silk yarn in the state
data.description: Subsidy of INR 3,200/- per worker per month will be provided to garmenting units, except in Gautam Budh Nagar and Ghaziabad district, for a period of 5 years.
data.how_to_apply: Scheme can be applied through Nivesh Mitra Portal of Uttar Pradesh Government
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Textile, Department of Textile
data.funding_mechanism: The beneficiary will get the benefit after the approval of application by the funding facilitator.
data.highlights: The Department of Handloom and Textiles, Government of Uttar Pradesh shall appoint a team of professionals as Project Management Agency (PMA) for policy implementation and supporting the department in publicizing the policy benefits among national / international investors, brands and other stakeholders and providing prompt support to the investors.
data.additional_info: Preference will be given to those resident/s, in purchase of land from UPSIDA, GIDA, NOIDA, GREATER NOIDA or other authorities, to start new employment.
data.checklist_info_a:
1.Copy of Udyam Registration Certificate (URC)
2. Certificate of Incorporation/ Partnership deed/Partnership registration/ Co- operative society 
registration. 
3.KYC Details
data.checklist_info_d: Picup Bhawan, Block A, 4th Floor, Lucknow, UP, 0522-3117976, info@investup.org.in
